utterance.speaker: LEANN WEST
utterance.content: Make sure you get the crowd in the background, Mark.

utterance.speaker: MARK
utterance.content: Another shot of you and the chanting masses. I’m so over this protest.

utterance.speaker: LEANN
utterance.content: Next time we’ll do a piece on Brazilian runway models. I promise.

utterance.speaker: MARK
utterance.content: Gonna hold you to that. All right, let’s roll this puppy.

utterance.speaker: LEANN
utterance.content: Roger that.

utterance.speaker: MARK
utterance.content: Hey Ringo! You’re messing up sound! How ‘bout you take it somewhere else?

utterance.speaker: MARK
utterance.content: Okay, live in 3 …

utterance.speaker: LEANN
utterance.content: I’m here at Boylan Plaza on day 36 of the takeover protest. Hundreds have gathered here and in cities across the country to take a stand against what they say is greed and corruption from –

utterance.speaker: LEANN
utterance.content: Oh my God. If you’ve just tuned in, there’s been some kind of explosion on the southeast side of the Boylan Plaza. We do not know what caused this or if there are injuries but I can see what appear to be people on the ground not moving.

utterance.speaker: RICHARD CASTLE
utterance.content: It’s unbelievable. Any idea how many people were killed?

utterance.speaker: KATE BECKETT
utterance.content: Initial reports say 5 dead, 28 injured.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: There’s Feds everywhere.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Well that’s normal procedure in the event of a bomb.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Nothing normal about this.

utterance.speaker: LEANN
utterance.content: Do they think this was a terrorist attack?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: No comment. You’ll have to deal with press relations.

utterance.speaker: AGENT JOHNSON
utterance.content: Oh, sorry.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: NYPD.

utterance.speaker: AGENT JOHNSON
utterance.content: NYPD’s over there. FBI’s taking jurisdiction of the crime scene.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Thanks.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: C’mon Castle.

utterance.speaker: JAVIER ESPOSITO
utterance.content: FBI turned you guys away too, huh?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yeah, they wouldn’t let us past the crime scene tape. What’s going on?

utterance.speaker: KEVIN RYAN
utterance.content: Gates is talking to the Feds, trying to get a handle on that.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What do we know about the explosion? Who set it off?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: It probably wasn’t a suicide bomber. I got a friend who’s a medic, said there were no explosive vests on any of the bodies.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Everything else is just rumor at this point.

utterance.speaker: CAPTAIN VICTORIA GATES
utterance.content: Listen up, people! We’re still piecing together what happened here, but what I can tell you is that FBI and Homeland Security will be taking point on this investigation. NYPD will act in a support capacity. Our first assignment is to see if any of the victims were targeted because of their involvement in the protest. Uniforms are bringing families to the precinct as we speak, so let’s go hold some hands and do our jobs.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Mr. Lavine, I understand one of the victims, Jesse Friedman, worked closely with you.

utterance.speaker: LAVINE
utterance.content: It was more than that. He was a friend. A comrade in arms, you know? Jesse was a recruiter. When attendance dropped a couple weeks back, even I thought it was time to pack up. But Jesse just threw my favorite quote back at me. The one about sinning by silence.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: “To sin by silence when we should protest makes …” “…cowards of men.”

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: We know this is difficult, but what was your husband’s involvement with the takeover movement?

utterance.speaker: VAL BROOKSTONE
utterance.content: Matt wasn’t involved. Neither am I.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: So why were you at Boylan Plaza?

utterance.speaker: VAL
utterance.content: It’s our first time here. We wanted to take in as much as we could.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: You’re tourists?

utterance.speaker: VAL
utterance.content: We’d just been to the top of the Empire State Building. We had an extra few minutes, so we decided to see what the protest was all about.

utterance.speaker: VAL
utterance.content: Matt and I just bought a house. We were going to start a family. We had all these plans. What am I going to do now?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You good?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yeah. Yeah. Just… this case, you know? Kind of gets to you. How’d it go with the rest of the families?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Um … One victim was the first kid in his family to go to college, and the other was the mother of 2, so .. … about like you’d expect. No one seems to have been targeted, though.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: So their deaths were at random. You know, most of our victims, they – they die for a reason, you know? There’s a logic behind it. It’s a twisted logic at times, but at least it makes some kind of sense.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah, but in this case these people were just in the wrong place at the wrong time.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: And their future and all their plans, everything is just gone in a flash.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: It makes you think about all those things in your own life that you don’t want to put off anymore.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yo.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Captain’s gathering the troops.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: Now that it appears that this attack was not directed at any specific individual we’ve got a new assignment for the FBI. We all know where the bomb went off. It was here, right next to this lamppost. The FBI just recovered this photo from a protester’s cell phone. It’s of the same location taken 47 seconds before the explosion. That could only mean one thing. The bomb was placed here by someone within our 47 second time period. Our task it to interview all witnesses who were present at Boylan Plaza. We’re looking for anyone who saw what went on by this lamppost before the blast.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Sir, there are over 300 names on this list. How do you recommend that we proceed?

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: We bring in more shifts. Someone on that list saw the bomb being planted within our 47 second window. We find that person, we find the bomber.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Thank you for your time.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Well that was … unhelpful.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yeah. I’m starting to sense a pattern.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You know, this next woman says she was in the middle of the whole thing.

utterance.speaker: CORINNE
utterance.content: We were right here. It’s like the bomb went off right next to us.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Who’s we?

utterance.speaker: CORINNE
utterance.content: Me and my sister Nadia. She’s out there right now, waiting. Should I go get her?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Uh, no. Actually it’s better if we just talk one on one. Now were the two of you participating in the protest?

utterance.speaker: CORINNE
utterance.content: Do I look like I’m in the 99%? No. We’d just left this bridal boutique near the plaza. Nadia’s getting married in June.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And did you notice anyone standing near the light post?

utterance.speaker: CORINNE
utterance.content: I don’t think so.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay, I’m going to need you to tell us everything that you remember from just before the bombing, starting with where you were.

utterance.speaker: CORINNE
utterance.content: We were at the coffee truck, just trying to figure out our next move.

utterance.speaker: CORINNE
utterance.content: I’m a little shopped out, Nadia. I mean, you tried on 11 dresses.

utterance.speaker: NADIA
utterance.content: It made me look like a stay-puffed marshmallow. We have to keep looking.

utterance.speaker: CORINNE
utterance.content: Can we look from home online?

utterance.speaker: NADIA
utterance.content: I’m not buying my wedding dress on the internet.

utterance.speaker: CORINNE
utterance.content: It’s just to give us ideas. We need to regroup. You are this close to Bridezilla territory.

utterance.speaker: NADIA
utterance.content: Well maybe I’ll wear jeans to my wedding. Maybe we can hire that guy as the band.

utterance.speaker: JESSE
utterance.content: That’s mine! Give it back!

utterance.speaker: CORINNE
utterance.content: Could you imagine the look on Mom’s face –

utterance.speaker: NADIA
utterance.content: Damn it! Watch where you’re going. This is my –

utterance.speaker: CORINNE
utterance.content: The force of it knocked us on our asses. Nadia almost got trampled.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Wait, can you go back to the Middle Eastern man carrying the box. You said that he was sweaty and nervous?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: And was he headed toward the lamppost?

utterance.speaker: CORINNE
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Do you remember his face well enough to help us with a sketch?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Westside Wally. Back by popular demand.

utterance.speaker: WESTSIDE WALLY
utterance.content: C’mon, Kojak. You know I prefer Westside.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Westside, then. Uh … did you ever see that man in the plaza?

utterance.speaker: WESTSIDE WALLY
utterance.content: No. The guy’s not familiar. Then again, lots of people, lots of faces. Plus, I was over here. That’s my usual spot. Not by the coffee truck. I don’t care for the smell.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: That puts you 50 feet away from where the bomb went off. Did you have a clear view of this lamppost?

utterance.speaker: WESTSIDE WALLY
utterance.content: Not really, man. And you know I always try to help Johnny Law.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Did you notice anything out the ordinary in the minute before the explosion? Anyone suspicious?

utterance.speaker: WESTSIDE WALLY
utterance.content: As a matter of fact, I did.

utterance.speaker: BEETHOVEN
utterance.content: We’re good to go.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Stop! Let me understand this. You – you saw Beethoven? The composer who’s been dead for 200 years in Boylan Plaza this afternoon.

utterance.speaker: WESTSIDE WALLY
utterance.content: Oh yeah. And I bet that half-deaf bastard is behind all of this.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Westside, are you on any medications of any kind?

utterance.speaker: WESTSIDE WALLY
utterance.content: I don’t see how that’s relevant.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: What do you mean we have no leads? What about the Middle Eastern man?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: We interviewed him. He cleared.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yeah, that box he was carrying? Full of Chinese takeout. The most dangerous thing in there was MSG.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Look, the fact is is that we interviewed 94 people and we’ve got nothing to show for it.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: Ah … this is not the news I was hoping for. Especially since the FBI sent this over. It was emailed to two other takeover locations an hour ago.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: “You were warned to stop the protest. You didn’t listen. Start listening now or today’s bombing will be just the beginning.”

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: He’s going to hit another protest.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: The FBI’s keeping this one under wraps. But the clock is still ticking here and what you’re telling me is that we’re no closer to getting this guy than we were when the bomb went off?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Sir, somebody on this list saw exactly what happened within that 47 second window, but the problem is is that they’re mixed in with all of these people that saw absolutely nothing.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: It’s like trying to find Waldo in a sea of Waldos.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: I take it you have a proposal to fix that?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: If the FBI would let us view all video shot in the plaza then maybe we can figure out who was closest to the bomb, start prioritizing the interviews.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: Okay. I’ll go down there, do my best. And if that doesn’t work, we’ll look to plan B. In the meantime, keep working on the list.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: She doesn’t seem very optimistic about getting that footage.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You know, the witnesses that were closest to the bomb aren’t on our list. Maybe dead men do tell tales.

utterance.speaker: LANIE PARISH
utterance.content: I just saw a reporter in reception. Have security get him out of here. I don’t want him bothering the victims' families.

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: So nice to see a friendly face. FBI’s been up in mine all night.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: All from the explosion?

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: They never had a chance. If you’re looking for official cause of death, it’s multiple blunt force trauma.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Actually, we were wondering if there was anything on the bodies that might lead us to whoever did this.

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: Possible. Meet Jesse Friedman.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: He was the recruiter for the takeover movement.

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: He was also the guy closest to the blast and we found bits of this imbedded all over his skin.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Blue fabric?

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: Lab ID’d it as canvas. They also found high concentrations of explosive residue on it.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: The canvas was part of whatever contained the bomb.

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: Looks that way.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: So a duffel or a suitcase?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: This is a huge break. That means we’re looking for someone carrying a blue bag.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Let’s go update Captain Gates.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Uh, can you just give me a minute?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah, sure.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Hey, honey. How’re you doing?

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS CASTLE
utterance.content: Yeah, I just needed a minute.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You look exhausted. How long’ve you been here?

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: I’m not sure. It’s been so crazy. I’ve been cataloguing the victims' personal effects.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well that can’t be easy.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: It was fine. Then I saw how one of them had on this bracelet strung with beads, made by a little kid and it was like that bracelet that I made you for Father’s Day when I was 6. Do you remember?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Remember? I still have it.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: C’mon. Let’s get you home.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: No, I should stay. There’s still work to do.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: And it’ll be here tomorrow.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Dr. Parish said I had to get all this finished before she –

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Lanie will tell you the same thing.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Let’s get you out of here.

utterance.speaker: MARK
utterance.content: All right, let’s roll this puppy.

utterance.speaker: LEANN WEST
utterance.content: Roger that.

utterance.speaker: NEWCASTER
utterance.content: That was our very own Leann West about to report live from Boylan Plaza yesterday. Moments later tragedy struck. Be aware, some of the images we’re about to show you may be disturbing to some viewers.

utterance.speaker: LEANN
utterance.content: Hundreds have gathered here and in cities across the country to take a stand against what they say is greed and corruption from – Oh my God.

utterance.speaker: NEWSCASTER
utterance.content: So far no suspects have been named in the bombing.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Thank you.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA RODGERS
utterance.content: You’re welcome. So how’s our – how’s our girl doing?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: She’s upstairs, in bed, asleep. Wish I could keep her in there.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Honey, do you ever wonder why I never visited you at the precinct the first year you were working there?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I always thought it was because of the harsh lighting.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Well, that was a consideration. No, I thought if I – if I saw you acting like a cop, I’d start thinking of you as a cop and I just – that – that brought on all manner of nightmares.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: How did you get over it?

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Eventually you realize your children are going to make choices you don’t like. Just a fact of life.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well if the bombing proves anything it’s that bad things can happen no matter what you do. No one’s tomorrow is guaranteed.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: So … how do you plan to act on this realization?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What do you mean?

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Oh, you know what I mean. Richard, how much longer are you going to drag your heels before you tell Beckett how you feel – and I mean while she is awake, not lying on the ground with a bullet in her chest.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You don’t understand. It’s –

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: It’s complicated, so you say. Only, it’s not. It’s not. Nobody’s tomorrows are guaranteed, right? Wouldn’t it be better to tell her, even if the timing is wrong, than never to tell her at all?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: And what if she isn’t ready?

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Then she never will be. Then you move on.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Hey.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Hey. Thanks.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You got a second?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah, what’s up?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Um… I’ve been thinking. About the victims and all the opportunities they’ll never have. And I don’t want that to happen.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I’ve been –

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Beckett? We’ve got something.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Um…

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: It’s okay. It can wait until after the case.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Did you get the video from the plaza?

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: Not yet, but what I’ve got here is even better. Data from wireless carriers that shows us all the activated cellphones in Boylan Plaza.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: This is the plaza yesterday at 4:32 right before the explosion. Each red dot represents the GPS position of a specific phone.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: How did you get this?

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: I called in a favor from a friend at Homeland Security.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: That is a damn good friend.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So if those red dots represent cell phones could we figure out who they belong to?

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: That’s the whole idea.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: This shows us who was closest to the bomb. It gives us our witnesses.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: It can even show us where everyone was in real time. Advance it to 4:32.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: The dots that disappeared, that’s the explosion.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Wait a second. Did you guys see that? It was – uh, before the bomb went off. Could you – Ryan, could you take it back 10 seconds?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: That dot right there. Right before the explosion. It goes to the blast site, waits for a second, and then rushes away.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: Play it again.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: That’s the bomber.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: I’ll see if I can pull up his ID.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Cell phone’s registered to an Andrew Haynes.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: Tell me where he is right now.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: No GPS signal. Uh … his battery’s either dead or his phone is off.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Wait a minute. Haynes sounds familiar. He showed up in the precinct 20 minutes ago for an interview.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: The bomber’s in the building?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Unis gave him a full body. No weapons, no explosives.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: He still thinks he’s here as a witness?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: We told him the search was routine.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: So this is Andrew Haynes. What’s his story?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: He has it out for the takeover movement. He’s organized counterdemonstrations, disrupted their rallies. He’s even handed out flyers saying how they should be stopped by any means necessary.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: He walks the walk, too. He was a suspect in the bombing of some Greenpeace offices a few years back.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Anything turn up at his place?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Yeah. Smoking gun. Unis found receipts to an internet café where he goes. They traced those threats back to that café and Haynes’ login ID. He’s our guy.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So then why is she strolling in here just as cool as can be?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: My guess? He’s proud of what he’s done. Can’t wait to tell someone about it.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Well then let’s give him the opportunity to do just that.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Hi, Mr, Haynes. I’m Detective Kate Beckett. Thanks so much for coming in.

utterance.speaker: ANDREW HAYNES
utterance.content: It’s about time you brought me in here. I had to rub elbows with those whiney little troublemakers. I was going to do something drastic.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Oh yeah well, I wouldn’t blame you.

utterance.speaker: HAYNES
utterance.content: A free thinker. I respect that.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Um, you know, my personal feelings aside I still have to investigate this incident.

utterance.speaker: HAYNES
utterance.content: Yeah, you know. You got to dot your I’s and cross your T’s. I get that.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Exactly. So I just have to ask you a few questions about what you saw just before the bombing, starting with where you were.

utterance.speaker: HAYNES
utterance.content: Uh … I – I was like, right up here.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Um, so that’s about 100 feet from the blast site?

utterance.speaker: HAYNES
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And what were you doing there?

utterance.speaker: HAYNES
utterance.content: Oh, I was pretty much getting hassled.

utterance.speaker: HAYNES
utterance.content: Hey, nimrod! Educate yourself. Here, why don’t you give this a read? Hey Garanimal pants. Quit the pity party. Get a frickin’ job. Pull yourself up by the bootstraps. Hello? Hey, I’m talking to you! Kitten, can you take –

utterance.speaker: HAYNES
utterance.content: What’s your problem? You don’t like what I have to say?

utterance.speaker: JESSE
utterance.content: Sorry.

utterance.speaker: HAYNES
utterance.content: Huh? Can’t face the truth?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I’m sorry, just - just so I’m clear. So you were debating with the protestors until that bomb went off?

utterance.speaker: HAYNES
utterance.content: Yeah, I was trying to give them a reality check. You know, they’re all up in arms about the greedy corporations. Who do they think is creating the jobs? You know, they’re a bunch of silver spoon hypocrites. I mean, half of them, they don’t – they don’t even know what they’re protesting against.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Right, and stopping them would actually be a service to this country.

utterance.speaker: HAYNES
utterance.content: Yeah, it’d be item number 1 on any true patriot’s to-do list.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And you are a true patriot, aren’t you? –

utterance.speaker: HAYNES
utterance.content: You’re damn right about that.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Andrew, that’s why you put that bomb in the plaza. To defend the country that you love?

utterance.speaker: HAYNES
utterance.content: What are you talking about?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: C’mon, Andrew. I don’t want you to have to serve any more time than you have to. We know that you weren’t with those protesters. You were down here, dropping off the bomb and then running for cover.

utterance.speaker: HAYNES
utterance.content: Based on what?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: We traced your phone. The GPS places you right there.

utterance.speaker: HAYNES
utterance.content: You can’t prove it was me. I lost my phone yesterday.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Really.

utterance.speaker: HAYNES
utterance.content: Mmhmm.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay, then maybe you can explain this. Threatening emails that you sent from an internet café promising to continue those bombings until the protest stopped.

utterance.speaker: HAYNES
utterance.content: I’d like to talk to my lawyer.

utterance.speaker: AGENT JOHNSON
utterance.content: White male, antisocial loner, extreme political views. He’s a perfect fit for the profile BSU worked up for us. We’ll continue questioning him downtown.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: Well, according to my people, he’s nowhere near confessing.

utterance.speaker: AGENT JOHNSON
utterance.content: We’ll have them reinterview the witnesses and find us someone that saw Haynes put that backpack down.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: You’re welcome.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: So it's up to 20 witnesses along Haynes’ GPS path but none of them could positively ID him.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: With all the confusion no one’s exactly sure what happened. You guys have any luck?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: 4 people remember seeing a guy in a black takeover hoodie but nobody remembers seeing his face.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: A black hoodie doesn’t get us home. Not with half the protesters wearing them.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Somebody must have seen this guy.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: There’s a protester that we haven’t talked to yet. The street drummer.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: After the cameraman rousted him, that bridesmaid said he relocated by the coffee truck, which would put him right in Haynes’s path.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Which means he could have seen Haynes’s face.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Yeah, but we don’t know his name and he’s not on our witness list. How’re we going to find this guy?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You know what? He’s a street performer. He’s probably got nuisance citations which means if he has we should be able to ID him.

utterance.speaker: MALIK
utterance.content: I make music. Why did you arrest me?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: We’re not arresting you, Malik. We just need to ask you a few questions about what you saw in Boylan Plaza yesterday afternoon.

utterance.speaker: MALIK
utterance.content: I know nothing about the bomb. I am an innocent man.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: And we believe you.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: But we think that you might have seen something that will help us catch the person that did this.

utterance.speaker: MALIK
utterance.content: I – I don’t want trouble.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Malik, your visa expired, didn’t it? Is that what’s worrying you?

utterance.speaker: MALIK
utterance.content: I cannot go back to my country.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And I won’t make you. I don’t care about your immigration status. We just need to know exactly what you saw just before that explosion.

utterance.speaker: MALIK
utterance.content: I will tell you what I can.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Okay.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: When you were playing by the coffee truck a man walked by you wearing a black takeover sweatshirt. Do you remember seeing him?

utterance.speaker: MALIK
utterance.content: Yes. I saw him.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Wait a minute, are you saying you saw the man wearing the black takeover sweatshirt put down a blue backpack in front of the lamppost?

utterance.speaker: MALIK
utterance.content: Yes.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: And did you get a good look at his face?

utterance.speaker: NADIA
utterance.content: Damn it!

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You’re certain the man you saw leaving the backpack was Hispanic and in his 20s?

utterance.speaker: MALIK
utterance.content: Yes.

utterance.speaker: MALIK
utterance.content: I – I give the wrong answer?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Are you sure this wasn’t the person?

utterance.speaker: MALIK
utterance.content: No. It’s not him.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: The FBI’s got the wrong guy.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Which means the real bomber is still out there.

utterance.speaker: AGENT JOHNSON
utterance.content: If Andrew Haynes didn’t plant the bomb then why did he email those threats? Why does his GPS show him fleeing the scene?

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: We can’t answer that yet but our witness gave a good description.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: It was this man.

utterance.speaker: AGENT JOHNSON
utterance.content: How do we know this guy’s not making this up?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Look, the details of the bomb haven’t been released to the press yet, so how would our witness know about the blue backpack unless he actually saw it?

utterance.speaker: AGENT JOHNSON
utterance.content: All right, you people pursue this. See where it leads. But Andrew Haynes is still our prime suspect. At least until you can give me more than the word of a street musician.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: Identifying this man, that is now our top priority. According to our witness he was wearing a takeover sweatshirt so he might be part of the movement. Show the sketch around, talk to other protesters. If he was a regular in Boylan Plaza someone must know who he is.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: Not you, Mr. Castle.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: I have a special task for you. I hear you’re quite the speed reader. And in the time that I’ve known you, you’ve shown …well, on occasion, an exceptional attention to detail.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: That’s the first time you’ve ever paid me a compliment.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Go on.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: We’ve conducted over 100 interviews so far and someone needs to review them swiftly, looking for information that can ID our suspect. And I believe you’re my best bet.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I think she’s finally starting to like me.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: No. I’m not.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I’m wearing her down.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Good morning.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Morning. Any breaks in the case?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: No. I’m pouring over these witness statements, looking for clues about our bomber, but so far nothing.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Well. Maybe these will bring you some luck.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: These are emergency cheering-up pancakes. I mean, these are usually reserved for after breakups or Dancing with the Stars eliminations. What’s the occasion?

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Well, after the other day I thought we both needed some cheering up.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You shouldn’t need cheering up. You shouldn’t have even been there. You should have been with your friends or at the movies.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Dad, I’m 18.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I know. I know. It’s just … you’re going to see plenty of reality in your lifetime. I just would like you to keep the rose color on your glasses for as long as possible.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: I’m trying not to focus on the ugly side of it, Dad. I’ve gotten straight As, awards, more trophies than I can count. This job is the first thing that’s made me feel like I’m doing something important. Valuable. I mean, isn’t that why you do it?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You’re a pretty smart kid, you know that?

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Well. They say genius skips a generation.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Apparently so does funny.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Eat your pancake.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Right.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Beckett.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: What’s going on?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Um … nothing. I’m thinking about my next move.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: I may have it for you. We got a line on this guy.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Someone ID’d the sketch?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Yeah. Protester named Jenny Klein says she knows this guy as Bobby.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And there’s no last name?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: No, but this Bobby invited her over once. She knows where he lives.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Hey Bobby.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Remove the backpack and place it on the ground, slowly.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Then get on your knees.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Just a bunch of gym clothes and some water bottles.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Not like last time, huh Bobby?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Robert Lopez. That’s your name. Right Bobby?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Actually I know quite a bit about you. I know where you live, I know you don’t have a record, I know you’re not a member of any political party, and as soon as my team finishes searching your place I’m going to know even more. Eventually I’ll find out, but why don’t you just tell me. Why did you plant that bomb?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Hey. No luck with those witness statements. You guys catch a break?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Better yet, we caught the suspect.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: And I missed it? Where is he?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: In the box. With Beckett.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Would you like me to refresh your memory? You were standing here, by the lamppost. You dropped the backpack and started running as it exploded, killing 5 people.

utterance.speaker: BOBBY
utterance.content: I didn’t do what you’re saying.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Witnesses saw you drop your backpack, Bobby.

utterance.speaker: BOBBY
utterance.content: It wasn’t mine.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Oh, so you admit to having it?

utterance.speaker: BOBBY
utterance.content: No, that’s – that’s not what I meant.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You just said that it wasn’t yours.

utterance.speaker: BOBBY
utterance.content: Yeah, because you got me all confused with –

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Did you or didn’t you have it? It’s a simple question.

utterance.speaker: BOBBY
utterance.content: I don’t know.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Who put you up to this, Bobby? Who gave you that backpack.

utterance.speaker: BOBBY
utterance.content: I don’t – I don’t know. I don’t remember.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You don’t remember. How do you not remember?

utterance.speaker: BOBBY
utterance.content: I was in shock. The bomb went off. Everyone was running and screaming and –

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay, okay, so you remember what happened after the bomb went off but not before?

utterance.speaker: BOBBY
utterance.content: It must have been one of those traumatic amnesia things.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Bobby. Don’t lie to me.

utterance.speaker: BOBBY
utterance.content: I’m telling you, it was all a big blank. It was the trauma.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: It was not the trauma. You do not get to use that excuse.

utterance.speaker: BOBBY
utterance.content: I swear I don’t remember!

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: The hell you don’t remember. Do you want to know trauma? I was shot in the chest and I remember every second of it.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And so do you.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: All this time. You remembered?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Guy’s still not talking?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Not yet. I’m gonna let him sweat for a bit. Was Castle here?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yeah. Earlier. But he said he had to go. Said there was somewhere he needed to be.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Oh Richard, really? A bomb memorial? C’mon, honey. Isn’t this kind of morbid?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well it’s how I’m feeling.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: She isn’t dead.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: She might as well be.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I really thought we could have a future together. You know, I was – I was willing to wait. Turns out it’s all just a big joke. She knew. This whole time, she remembered. And she didn’t say anything … because she was embarrassed because she doesn’t feel the same way. I’m such a fool.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Well c’mon. Let’s go home. Break out some of the good stuff, okay?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well I’d love to. I’ve got to be getting back.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Back? Why on Earth would you go back, knowing how she feels, knowing that she lied to you –

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: No, no, no. This isn’t about her. This is – this is about them. You know? It’s about doing something real. Something that matters. I’m not willing to let that go.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Richard, love is not a switch. You can’t just turn it off. You can’t work side by side with her and not feel anything.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Watch me.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Hey.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Hey. Where were you?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Just clearing my head. Where are we on Bobby?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Uniforms are searching his place. We’re hoping to find something that’ll break him.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: FBI called with an update. The device used in Boylan Plaza was a pipe bomb. But here’s the weird part. It wasn’t packed with nails, ball bearings, or anything else.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: That is weird. Bombers usually add projectiles to maximize damage.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: That’s not the only way to maximize damage.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Uh, so what was it triggered by? Cell phone? Trip wire?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: A remote, probably rigged from a garage door opener. But the range on those is only about 100 feet.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: So whoever detonated it was in Boylan Plaza.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And I bet you we’ll find that garage remote in Bobby’s apartment.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Ah … no such luck. But we did find credit cards with lots of different names on them and we found some wallets and some cell phones, too. In fact, one of those cell phones belonged to Andrew Haynes.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Bobby’s a pickpocket.

utterance.speaker: BOBBY
utterance.content: Yeah, I pretty much am.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: That’s why you attended the takeover protests.

utterance.speaker: BOBBY
utterance.content: All those people were hanging out full of peace and brotherhood.

utterance.speaker: ANDREW HAYNES
utterance.content: Hey nimrod. Educate yourself.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: It’s like an all-you-can-steal buffet.

utterance.speaker: BOBBY
utterance.content: You got that right.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Why didn’t you just tell me the truth from the start?

utterance.speaker: BOBBY
utterance.content: And what? Admit to a cop who likes me for murder that I’m a thief? Amnesia seemed like the better plan.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yeah. So you lifted Andrew Haynes’s phone, which is why it looked as if he planted the bomb.

utterance.speaker: BOBBY
utterance.content: Who’s Andrew Haynes?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Don’t worry about that. Talk to me about the backpack. How did you get it?

utterance.speaker: BOBBY
utterance.content: I lifted it.

utterance.speaker: BOBBY
utterance.content: It was just lying there between two dumpsters.

utterance.speaker: JESSE FRIEDMAN
utterance.content: Hey! Hey! That’s mine.

utterance.speaker: JESSE
utterance.content: Hey, that’s mine! Give that back!

utterance.speaker: JESSE
utterance.content: Hey! Hey, that’s my bag.

utterance.speaker: JESSE
utterance.content: Come back! Come back, hey you!

utterance.speaker: BOBBY
utterance.content: I swear, I didn’t know a bomb was in it. I would never hurt anyone. Look, you gotta believe me.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: The man who said that you took his backpack, is that him?

utterance.speaker: BOBBY
utterance.content: Yeah. That’s – that’s the guy.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Are you sure?

utterance.speaker: BOBBY
utterance.content: Yeah, that’s him.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: That’s Jesse Friedman. That’s one of the victims.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And he’s a member of the movement.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: That doesn’t make any sense. Why would he attack his own people?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay. Thank you.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So unis searched Jesse Friedman’s place and they found research on how to build the same device that was used in Boylan Plaza.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: So Jesse blew up his own protest? Why would he do that?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Maybe to … get sympathy for his movement? Publicity?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: And because he placed the bomb between two dumpsters he didn’t –

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: - didn’t think that anyone would get hurt. Then Bobby stole the backpack.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: If Jesse was worried about someone getting hurt why would he set off the bomb?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: I don’t think he did. There was no remote on or near the body which means someone else detonated it.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Probably someone he knew. 30 seconds before the blast Jesse got a call on his cell from a burner cell. Then 2 seconds before the bomb went off he tried to call that same phone back.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So then maybe Jesse had a partner and that’s who triggered the bomb.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You said that remote had a range of about 100 feet, right?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Mmhmm.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Whoever the partner was he must have been here somewhere, close to the bomb blast, hidden amongst the crowd. We need to take another look at the sequence of events. Piece together the witness statements. The answer is in the story. So let’s start at the beginning.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Leann and her cameraman are setting up for their live broadcast.

utterance.speaker: LEANN
utterance.content: Make sure you get the crowd in the background, Mark.

utterance.speaker: MARK
utterance.content: Another shot of you and the chanting masses. I’m so over this protest.

utterance.speaker: LEANN
utterance.content: Yeah, next time we’ll do a piece on Brazilian runway models. I promise.

utterance.speaker: MARK
utterance.content: Gonna hold you to that. All right, let’s roll this puppy.

utterance.speaker: LEANN
utterance.content: Roger that.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: At the same time, Bobby’s prowling the plaza. He sees Andrew Haynes haranguing the protesters.

utterance.speaker: HAYNES
utterance.content: Stop the pity party. Pull yourself up by the bootstraps. Hey nimrod, educate yourself. Why don’t you give this a read. Hey Garanimal pants.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: He’s easy pickin’s.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: So Bobby relieves him of his phone.

utterance.speaker: ANDREW
utterance.content: Educate yourself, would you?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Then Bobby goes looking for his next business opportunity. He spots the blue backpack unattended, calling out to him. So he grabs it, blissfully unaware of what’s inside.

utterance.speaker: JESSE
utterance.content: Hey! Hey, that’s mine!

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: But Jesse sees him and he flips out.

utterance.speaker: JESSE
utterance.content: That’s mine!

utterance.speaker: JESSE
utterance.content: Give that back! Hey! Hey, that’s mine.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Bobby ducks out of sight. Jesse panics. The bomb is on the move. What’s he gonna do? People are in danger. He grabs a man in the black hoodie, thinking it’s the thief.

utterance.speaker: HAYNES
utterance.content: What’s your problem? You don’t like what I have to say?

utterance.speaker: JESSE
utterance.content: Sorry.

utterance.speaker: HAYNES
utterance.content: Huh? Can’t face the truth?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: But it’s Andrew Haynes. Well by now, Bobby’s decided taking the backpack wasn’t such a good idea.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: So he ditches it and keeps moving.

utterance.speaker: NADIA
utterance.content: Could you imagine the look on Mom’s face?

utterance.speaker: NADIA
utterance.content: Damn it!

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Bam. They knock into each other, drawing the attention of the street drummer who’s now by the coffee truck.

utterance.speaker: OPERATOR
utterance.content: The subscriber you are trying to reach is not available –

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: He’s too late.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Well, that’s a nice story bro, but it still doesn’t tell us who Jesse’s partner is.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Well it’s gotta be whoever Jesse was on the phone with in the minutes before the bomb went off.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: How long was that first incoming call?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Uh … 8 seconds.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: So that was probably the ‘all systems go’ call.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Then after the backpack was stolen Jesse tried to make an ‘all systems not go’ call but he didn’t get through in time.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Do any of the witnesses remember who Jesse was hanging out with?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Not yet but we’re still reconstructing his movements based on statements on his friends –

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Oh! A Beethoven T-shirt. Call and response. I know who Jesse’s partner is.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Bobby remembered hearing a Beethoven ringtone coming from nearby just before he stole the backpack. And Westside Wally said Beethoven showed up conducting his 5th Symphony.

utterance.speaker: BEETHOVEN
utterance.content: We’re good to go.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: That was actually Jesse Friedman with his Beethoven T-Shirt and ringtone making his ‘all systems go’ call.

utterance.speaker: JESSE
utterance.content: We’re good to go.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: We know he was talking to someone within 100 feet and that call lasted 8 seconds, long enough for a call and response. A call and response to the one person who could broadcast the explosion live on television and bring the publicity that the movement needed.

utterance.speaker: JESSE
utterance.content: We’re good to go.

utterance.speaker: LEANN
utterance.content: Roger that.

utterance.speaker: LEANN
utterance.content: I’m here at Boylan Plaza on day 36 of the takeover protest.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Leann West was on the other end of that phone.

utterance.speaker: LEANN
utterance.content: No I wasn’t. I wasn’t on the phone with anyone. I was talking to my cameraman. I already told the FBI the whole story.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yeah, except you left out a few details.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Like the fact that you knew Jesse Friedman. The two of you went to Hudson University.

utterance.speaker: LEANN
utterance.content: Yeah, so did a lot of people.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: We’re guessing the two of you reunited at the protest. You went out for drinks and you hatched a plan.
